chapter.title: Chapter 5: Special Features
chapter.para: This chapter is structured as follows:

section.title: Map Control
section.para: Map control is fairly simple: you got two maps in a game scene, one of which only is a smaller version of the other one. The big map is on the left and that's where the action takes place, the little map on the right is meerely a navigation tool. To control the big map, use your mouse as follows:

varlistentry.term: left click: only has an impact if clicked on a highlighted place
right button down + move mouse: moves map in the direction of your mouse movement
middle button down + move mouse up: zoom in
middle button down + move mouse down: zoom out

section.para: When you left click + move mouse in the little map, a red rectangle is drawn between the point where your left mouse button is pressed down and the point when its released. As soon as you release the mouse button, the map segment that is inside this rectangle gets displayed on the big map.

section.title: Music Player
section.para: Flat Hunt comes with an integrated music player and some default background music. Since not everyone likes the same sound, there is also the possibility to play your own. Just put your .ogg -files in the directory ${FLAT_HUNT}/resources/sound before you start the Flat Hunt application. Flat Hunt will then automatically load all the .ogg -files from this directory and play them in alphabetical order (unless you enable shuffle, obviously). Music player control: see Keyboard Shortcuts.

section.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
section.para: During the game, the following shortcuts are available:

varlistentry.term: p: pause the game and show pause menu.
shift + v: music player increase volume (at startup volume is already at maximum)
page up: music player next song
page down: music player previous song
